thread.title: Paul Pogba's agent jets into Manchester amid criticism of United's £89m star ahead of crunch Europa League clash
thread.title_full: Paul Pogba's agent jets into Manchester amid criticism of United's £89m star ahead of crunch Europa League clash

author: Liam Corless
title: Paul Pogba's agent jets into Manchester amid criticism of United's £89m star ahead of crunch Europa League clash
text:
Sport Paul Pogba's agent jets into Manchester amid criticism of United's £89m star ahead of crunch Europa League clash Pogba has been widely criticised for his display in United's FA Cup quarter-final loss to Chelsea on Monday night Share Manchester United will face Rostov in the Europa League on Thursday night (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Share Get Manchester United FC   
Paul Pogba's agent Mino Raiola arrived in Manchester on Thursday morning as criticism of his client continues to intensify. 
The super-agent is expected to be in attendance at Old Trafford in the evening as United attempt to qualify for the quarter-finals of the Europa League against FC Rostov. 
The tie is finely poised at 1-1 from the first leg and United manager Jose Mourinho is set to keep faith in Pogba by naming the £89million signing in his starting XI. 
United's players were pictured leaving The Lowry Hotel on Thursday morning ahead of the 8.05pm kick-off at the Theatre of Dreams. 
Mourinho hailed Pogba as the best player on the pitch in Monday's FA Cup loss to Chelsea but not too many people agreed with United's Portuguese boss. Paul Pogba was widely criticised for his display against Chelsea on Monday night (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) The Frenchman's agent, Mino Raiola, jetted into Manchester on Thursday (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) United boss Jose Mourinho defended Pogba's performance at Stamford Bridge (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) 
He was criticised for his role in Chelsea's goal after failing to close N'Golo Kante down on the edge of the box and allowing his countryman a free shot on goal which nestled in the corner of the net. 
Pogba was also castigated by Jamie Carragher and Frank Lampard last week, with Carragher describing him as a "liability" and Lampard branding him a "£90million problem". 
Agent Raiola made a huge amount of money from Pogba's summer switch from Juventus to United, with the Italian club claiming he pocketed £24million from the transfer. Zlatan Ibrahimovic leaves The Lowry Hotel ahead of United's clash with Rostov (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Chris Smalling (left), Marcus Rashford (centre) and Phil Jones (right) leave The Lowry Hotel (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) 
The 49-year-old could be involved in another huge saga this year after it emerged that another of his clients, Everton striker Romelu Lukaku, is refusing to sign a new contract at Goodison Park. 
That is despite Raiola last month saying that the Belgian was “99.9999%” certain to extend his deal with the Toffees. 
Lukaku, who wants to test himself against Europe's best in  , hinted Everton's lack of ambition in the transfer market is behind his refusal to sign an extension, saying: "There were some players I knew the club could have got and they didn’t, and they’re playing in this league. Romelu Lukaku is refusing to sign a new deal at Everton (Photo: Getty Images) The Belgian is keen to play in   as soon as possible (Photo: Everton FC via Getty Images) 
"I am not saying names, but they are doing well.” 
Chelsea are confident of re-signing Lukaku, who they sold to Everton for £28million in 2014, and are also targeting his teammate Ross Barkley in a £100million double summer swoop. Like us on Facebook
